title: Migration fuels second largest population jump in England and Wales for more than 75 years
description: Data shows population rose by 700,000 in year to June 2024, with international migration driving growth
content:
The population of England and Wales has grown by the second largest annual increase in more than 75 years, largely due to international migration.
Figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) show the population grew by 700,000 in the year t... [2737 chars]

title: ‘True visionary’ theatre school founder Sylvia Young dies aged 86
description: Founded in London in 1972, the Sylvia Young theatre school helped shape careers of singers and actors from Amy Winehouse to Billie Piper and Nicholas Hoult
content:
Sylvia Young – the founder of a theatre school that taught the likes of the singer Amy Winehouse, the EastEnders actor Adam Woodyatt and the James Bond star Lashana Lynch – has been hailed as a “true visionary” after she died aged 86.
Her daughters A... [3516 chars]

title: Zack Polanski’s ‘eco-populism’ could put voters off Greens, opponents say
description: Exclusive: Adrian Ramsay and Ellie Chowns say party could slide into irrelevance if it chooses new leader with ‘polarising’ approach
content:
The Green party risks going into reverse if they elect Zack Polanski as leader, his two opponents have said, arguing that his promised brand of “eco-populism” would prove polarising, divisive and likely to put off more moderate voters.
Speaking to th... [4743 chars]

title: Aston Martin’s 24-hour scramble to get lower US tariffs pays off
description: Carmaker avoids reporting a slump by sending three months’ worth of sales on last day of the quarter at levy of 10%
content:
Aston Martin scrambled to deliver three months’ worth of cars to dealers in the US within 24 hours as it rushed to qualify for lower tariffs that came into effect on 30 June.
By invoicing the whole quarter’s cars on that same day it avoided having to... [3878 chars]

title: National Lottery sales and payouts to pause for 36 hours for 'unprecedented' upgrade
description: New games and a better experience for players is being promised by the lottery operator - alongside a doubling in weekly returns for good causes.
content:
National Lottery sales and payouts will pause for around 36 hours this weekend for an "unprecedented" technology upgrade.
All draw game sales and prize claims will be paused in shops across the UK from 11pm on Saturday after the Lotto and Thunderball... [2087 chars]
